name: CrewAI Generator
description: Generate Complete CrewAI Projects (Converted from Langflow Store for AxieStudio compatibility)

code.value:
from axiestudio.base.io.text import TextComponent
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class TextInputComponent(TextComponent):
    display_name = "Text Input"
    description = "Get text inputs from the Playground."
    icon = "type"
    name = "TextInput"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Text to be passed as input.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Text", name="text", method="text_response"),
    ]

    def text_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
        )
        return message

input_value.name: input_value
input_value.value: Generate SEO optimized to create Landing Page websites. The project aims to search web pages based on keywords, select the 3 best positioned websites, obtain their metadata, focus on the main tags for SEO, use the topics and subtopics received to delete unnecessary content out of context, relate these topics and subtopics to the remaining content, reformulate the website content by adding the objective of the Landing Page, always remembering to semantically emphasize the keywords and tags for SEO, add internal links and validate the entire semantic and structural construction of the website following an existing model.
input_value.info: Text to be passed as input.

node.description: Insert detailed context for the project here. Describe the background, industry, or problem that the project aims to address. Provide any specific requirements or constraints that should be considered.

code.value:
from axiestudio.base.prompts.api_utils import process_prompt_template
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.inputs.inputs import DefaultPromptField
from axiestudio.io import Output, PromptInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.template.utils import update_template_values


class PromptComponent(Component):
    display_name: str = "Prompt"
    description: str = "Create a prompt template with dynamic variables."
    icon = "prompts"
    trace_type = "prompt"
    name = "Prompt"

    inputs = [
        PromptInput(name="template", display_name="Template"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Prompt Message", name="prompt", method="build_prompt"),
    ]

    async def build_prompt(
        self,
    ) -> Message:
        prompt = await Message.from_template_and_variables(**self._attributes)
        self.status = prompt.text
        return prompt

    def _update_template(self, frontend_node: dict):
        prompt_template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        custom_fields = frontend_node["custom_fields"]
        frontend_node_template = frontend_node["template"]
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=prompt_template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=custom_fields,
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node_template,
        )
        return frontend_node

    def post_code_processing(self, new_frontend_node: dict, current_frontend_node: dict):
        """
        This function is called after the code validation is done.
        """
        frontend_node = super().post_code_processing(new_frontend_node, current_frontend_node)
        template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        # Kept it duplicated for backwards compatibility
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=frontend_node["custom_fields"],
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node["template"],
        )
        # Now that template is updated, we need to grab any values that were set in the current_frontend_node
        # and update the frontend_node with those values
        update_template_values(new_template=frontend_node, previous_template=current_frontend_node["template"])
        return frontend_node

    def _get_fallback_input(self, **kwargs):
        return DefaultPromptField(**kwargs)
code.name: code

template.name: template
template.value:
You are tasked with designing a comprehensive AI-driven project using the CrewAI framework. The goal of this project is to develop an AI system that can {OverallGoal}. This project will involve multiple agents, each with distinct roles, backstories, and goals. The project will utilize a variety of tools, require collaboration among agents, and incorporate processes like planning, testing, and memory.

Context:
{Context}

Key Requirements:
Agents:

Design at least three distinct agents, each with specific roles and goals that align with the context.
Provide detailed backstories and goals for each agent to ensure they work effectively within the crew.
Integrate memory features for agents to recall important information throughout the project.
Tasks:

Create tasks that align with the roles of the agents. Each task should have a clear description and expected output.
{Tasks}
Ensure tasks are well-defined with clear expected outputs and associated tools.
Tools:

Utilize a variety of tools within the CrewAI framework, including search engines, APIs, and databases.
If necessary, create custom tools that agents can use to perform their tasks.
Integrate tools for specific tasks, ensuring that each tool is appropriate for the task at hand.
Processes:

Define the processes by which tasks will be executed (e.g., sequential, parallel, hierarchical).
Include steps for planning and testing to ensure quality output.
Incorporate feedback loops for continuous improvement throughout the process.
Collaboration:

Ensure that agents collaborate effectively by sharing information and resources.
Design mechanisms for agents to communicate and delegate tasks to each other.
Include a collaboration strategy for integrating human input during critical stages.
Training:

Include a training phase for agents to fine-tune their skills before they begin the main tasks.
Define how training data will be used to improve agent performance.
Create tasks that simulate real-world scenarios to test agent capabilities.
Memory:

Implement a memory system that allows agents to remember important details, past interactions, and decisions.
Use memory to enable agents to build upon previous work and avoid redundancy.
Ensure memory is persistent and accessible across tasks and processes.
Planning and Testing:

Design a planning phase where agents map out their approach to tasks.
Include testing phases where agents validate their findings, prototypes, or written reports.
Ensure that planning and testing are iterative, with opportunities for agents to refine their strategies.
Final Output:

The final output of this CrewAI project should be {FinalDeliverable}.
The deliverable should include {FinalOutput}.
The deliverable must be detailed, well-organized, and suitable for publication or presentation.
Additional Considerations:
Make sure that the agents can handle unexpected changes or new information during the project.
The system should be robust enough to allow human intervention or input at key decision points.
Consider how to evaluate the effectiveness of the agents and the overall success of the project.
Final Deliverable:

The final deliverable should be a complete CrewAI project setup, including all agents, tasks, tools and processes. The project should be ready to execute and provide the expected output in a seamless and efficient manner.

from axiestudio.base.io.text import TextComponent
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class TextInputComponent(TextComponent):
    display_name = "Text Input"
    description = "Get text inputs from the Playground."
    icon = "type"
    name = "TextInput"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Text to be passed as input.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Text", name="text", method="text_response"),
    ]

    def text_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
        )
        return message

input_value.name: input_value
input_value.value: - Search on Google with the keywords entered. - Get the top 3 links. - Access the websites and acquire information such as metadata relevant to SEO. - Scan the website focusing on the content of the tags most relevant to SEO, such as tags h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, h6, p, em, strong, article, main, summary, section, nav, header, footer, aside, a, ol, ul, li, blockquote, q, code. - From the topics and subtopics received, delete things that do not make sense with their objective and the Keywords. - Relate the topics and Sub Topics received with the remaining content. - Reformulate the website content by adding the objective of the Landing Page, always remembering to semantically emphasize the keywords and tags for SEO. - Add internal links received. - Manually validate all the semantics and construction of the website following the model received.

from axiestudio.base.io.text import TextComponent
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class TextOutputComponent(TextComponent):
    display_name = "Text Output"
    description = "Display a text output in the Playground."
    icon = "type"
    name = "TextOutput"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Text to be passed as output.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Text", name="text", method="text_response"),
    ]

    def text_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
        )
        self.status = self.input_value
        return message

api_key.name: api_key

code.value:
import operator
from functools import reduce

from axiestudio.field_typing.range_spec import RangeSpec
from langchain_openai import ChatOpenAI
from pydantic.v1 import SecretStr

from axiestudio.base.models.model import LCModelComponent
from axiestudio.base.models.openai_constants import OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES
from axiestudio.field_typing import LanguageModel
from axiestudio.inputs import (
    BoolInput,
    DictInput,
    DropdownInput,
    FloatInput,
    IntInput,
    SecretStrInput,
    StrInput,
)


class OpenAIModelComponent(LCModelComponent):
    display_name = "OpenAI"
    description = "Generates text using OpenAI LLMs."
    icon = "OpenAI"
    name = "OpenAIModel"

    inputs = LCModelComponent._base_inputs + [
        IntInput(
            name="max_tokens",
            display_name="Max Tokens",
            advanced=True,
            info="The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to 0 for unlimited tokens.",
            range_spec=RangeSpec(min=0, max=128000),
        ),
        DictInput(name="model_kwargs", display_name="Model Kwargs", advanced=True),
        BoolInput(
            name="json_mode",
            display_name="JSON Mode",
            advanced=True,
            info="If True, it will output JSON regardless of passing a schema.",
        ),
        DictInput(
            name="output_schema",
            is_list=True,
            display_name="Schema",
            advanced=True,
            info="The schema for the Output of the model. You must pass the word JSON in the prompt. If left blank, JSON mode will be disabled.",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="model_name",
            display_name="Model Name",
            advanced=False,
            options=OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES,
            value=OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES[0],
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="openai_api_base",
            display_name="OpenAI API Base",
            advanced=True,
            info="The base URL of the OpenAI API. Defaults to https://api.openai.com/v1. You can change this to use other APIs like JinaChat, LocalAI and Prem.",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="api_key",
            display_name="OpenAI API Key",
            info="The OpenAI API Key to use for the OpenAI model.",
            advanced=False,
            value="OPENAI_API_KEY",
        ),
        FloatInput(name="temperature", display_name="Temperature", value=0.1),
        IntInput(
            name="seed",
            display_name="Seed",
            info="The seed controls the reproducibility of the job.",
            advanced=True,
            value=1,
        ),
    ]

    def build_model(self) -> LanguageModel:  # type: ignore[type-var]
        # self.output_schema is a list of dictionaries
        # let's convert it to a dictionary
        output_schema_dict: dict[str, str] = reduce(operator.ior, self.output_schema or {}, {})
        openai_api_key = self.api_key
        temperature = self.temperature
        model_name: str = self.model_name
        max_tokens = self.max_tokens
        model_kwargs = self.model_kwargs or {}
        openai_api_base = self.openai_api_base or "https://api.openai.com/v1"
        json_mode = bool(output_schema_dict) or self.json_mode
        seed = self.seed

        if openai_api_key:
            api_key = SecretStr(openai_api_key)
        else:
            api_key = None
        output = ChatOpenAI(
            max_tokens=max_tokens or None,
            model_kwargs=model_kwargs,
            model=model_name,
            base_url=openai_api_base,
            api_key=api_key,
            temperature=temperature if temperature is not None else 0.1,
            seed=seed,
        )
        if json_mode:
            if output_schema_dict:
                output = output.with_structured_output(schema=output_schema_dict, method="json_mode")  # type: ignore
            else:
                output = output.bind(response_format={"type": "json_object"})  # type: ignore

        return output  # type: ignore

    def _get_exception_message(self, e: Exception):
        """
        Get a message from an OpenAI exception.

        Args:
            exception (Exception): The exception to get the message from.

        Returns:
            str: The message from the exception.
        """

        try:
            from openai import BadRequestError
        except ImportError:
            return
        if isinstance(e, BadRequestError):
            message = e.body.get("message")  # type: ignore
            if message:
                return message
        return
code.name: code

json_mode.name: json_mode
json_mode.info: If True, it will output JSON regardless of passing a schema.

max_tokens.name: max_tokens
max_tokens.info: The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to 0 for unlimited tokens.

openai_api_base.name: openai_api_base
openai_api_base.info: The base URL of the OpenAI API. Defaults to https://api.openai.com/v1. You can change this to use other APIs like JinaChat, LocalAI and Prem.

output_schema.name: output_schema
output_schema.info: The schema for the Output of the model. You must pass the word JSON in the prompt. If left blank, JSON mode will be disabled.

seed.name: seed
seed.info: The seed controls the reproducibility of the job.

stream.name: stream
stream.info: Stream the response from the model. Streaming works only in Chat.

system_message.name: system_message
system_message.info: System message to pass to the model.

from axiestudio.base.prompts.api_utils import process_prompt_template
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.inputs.inputs import DefaultPromptField
from axiestudio.io import Output, PromptInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.template.utils import update_template_values


class PromptComponent(Component):
    display_name: str = "Prompt"
    description: str = "Create a prompt template with dynamic variables."
    icon = "prompts"
    trace_type = "prompt"
    name = "Prompt"

    inputs = [
        PromptInput(name="template", display_name="Template"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Prompt Message", name="prompt", method="build_prompt"),
    ]

    async def build_prompt(
        self,
    ) -> Message:
        prompt = await Message.from_template_and_variables(**self._attributes)
        self.status = prompt.text
        return prompt

    def _update_template(self, frontend_node: dict):
        prompt_template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        custom_fields = frontend_node["custom_fields"]
        frontend_node_template = frontend_node["template"]
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=prompt_template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=custom_fields,
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node_template,
        )
        return frontend_node

    def post_code_processing(self, new_frontend_node: dict, current_frontend_node: dict):
        """
        This function is called after the code validation is done.
        """
        frontend_node = super().post_code_processing(new_frontend_node, current_frontend_node)
        template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        # Kept it duplicated for backwards compatibility
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=frontend_node["custom_fields"],
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node["template"],
        )
        # Now that template is updated, we need to grab any values that were set in the current_frontend_node
        # and update the frontend_node with those values
        update_template_values(new_template=frontend_node, previous_template=current_frontend_node["template"])
        return frontend_node

    def _get_fallback_input(self, **kwargs):
        return DefaultPromptField(**kwargs)

You are tasked with designing a comprehensive AI-driven project using the CrewAI framework. The goal of this project is to develop an AI system that can {OverallGoal}. This project will involve multiple agents, each with distinct roles, backstories, and goals. The project will utilize a variety of tools, require collaboration among agents, and incorporate processes like planning, testing, and memory.

Context:
{Context}

Key Requirements:
Agents:

Design at least three distinct agents, each with specific roles and goals that align with the context.
Provide detailed backstories and goals for each agent to ensure they work effectively within the crew.
Integrate memory features for agents to recall important information throughout the project.
Tasks:

Create tasks that align with the roles of the agents. Each task should have a clear description and expected output.
{Tasks}
Ensure tasks are well-defined with clear expected outputs and associated tools.
Tools:

Utilize a variety of tools within the CrewAI framework, including search engines, APIs, and databases.
If necessary, create custom tools that agents can use to perform their tasks.
Integrate tools for specific tasks, ensuring that each tool is appropriate for the task at hand.
Processes:

Define the processes by which tasks will be executed (e.g., sequential, parallel, hierarchical).
Include steps for planning and testing to ensure quality output.
Incorporate feedback loops for continuous improvement throughout the process.
Collaboration:

Ensure that agents collaborate effectively by sharing information and resources.
Design mechanisms for agents to communicate and delegate tasks to each other.
Include a collaboration strategy for integrating human input during critical stages.
Training:

Include a training phase for agents to fine-tune their skills before they begin the main tasks.

Memory:

Implement a memory system that allows agents to remember important details, past interactions, and decisions.

Ensure memory is persistent and accessible across tasks and processes.
Planning and Testing:

The final output of this CrewAI project should be {FinalDeliverable}.
The deliverable should include {FinalOutput}.
The deliverable must be detailed, well-organized, and suitable for publication or presentation.
Additional Considerations:

code.value:
from axiestudio.base.io.text import TextComponent
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class TextInputComponent(TextComponent):
    display_name = "Text Input"
    description = "Get text inputs from the Playground."
    icon = "type"
    name = "TextInput"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Text to be passed as input.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Text", name="text", method="text_response"),
    ]

    def text_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
        )
        return message

code.value:
from axiestudio.base.io.text import TextComponent
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class TextOutputComponent(TextComponent):
    display_name = "Text Output"
    description = "Display a text output in the Playground."
    icon = "type"
    name = "TextOutput"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Text to be passed as output.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Text", name="text", method="text_response"),
    ]

    def text_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
        )
        self.status = self.input_value
        return message

code.value:
import operator
from functools import reduce

from axiestudio.field_typing.range_spec import RangeSpec
from langchain_openai import ChatOpenAI
from pydantic.v1 import SecretStr

from axiestudio.base.models.model import LCModelComponent
from axiestudio.base.models.openai_constants import OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES
from axiestudio.field_typing import LanguageModel
from axiestudio.inputs import (
    BoolInput,
    DictInput,
    DropdownInput,
    FloatInput,
    IntInput,
    SecretStrInput,
    StrInput,
)


class OpenAIModelComponent(LCModelComponent):
    display_name = "OpenAI"
    description = "Generates text using OpenAI LLMs."
    icon = "OpenAI"
    name = "OpenAIModel"

    inputs = LCModelComponent._base_inputs + [
        IntInput(
            name="max_tokens",
            display_name="Max Tokens",
            advanced=True,
            info="The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to 0 for unlimited tokens.",
            range_spec=RangeSpec(min=0, max=128000),
        ),
        DictInput(name="model_kwargs", display_name="Model Kwargs", advanced=True),
        BoolInput(
            name="json_mode",
            display_name="JSON Mode",
            advanced=True,
            info="If True, it will output JSON regardless of passing a schema.",
        ),
        DictInput(
            name="output_schema",
            is_list=True,
            display_name="Schema",
            advanced=True,
            info="The schema for the Output of the model. You must pass the word JSON in the prompt. If left blank, JSON mode will be disabled.",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="model_name",
            display_name="Model Name",
            advanced=False,
            options=OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES,
            value=OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES[0],
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="openai_api_base",
            display_name="OpenAI API Base",
            advanced=True,
            info="The base URL of the OpenAI API. Defaults to https://api.openai.com/v1. You can change this to use other APIs like JinaChat, LocalAI and Prem.",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="api_key",
            display_name="OpenAI API Key",
            info="The OpenAI API Key to use for the OpenAI model.",
            advanced=False,
            value="OPENAI_API_KEY",
        ),
        FloatInput(name="temperature", display_name="Temperature", value=0.1),
        IntInput(
            name="seed",
            display_name="Seed",
            info="The seed controls the reproducibility of the job.",
            advanced=True,
            value=1,
        ),
    ]

    def build_model(self) -> LanguageModel:  # type: ignore[type-var]
        # self.output_schema is a list of dictionaries
        # let's convert it to a dictionary
        output_schema_dict: dict[str, str] = reduce(operator.ior, self.output_schema or {}, {})
        openai_api_key = self.api_key
        temperature = self.temperature
        model_name: str = self.model_name
        max_tokens = self.max_tokens
        model_kwargs = self.model_kwargs or {}
        openai_api_base = self.openai_api_base or "https://api.openai.com/v1"
        json_mode = bool(output_schema_dict) or self.json_mode
        seed = self.seed

        if openai_api_key:
            api_key = SecretStr(openai_api_key)
        else:
            api_key = None
        output = ChatOpenAI(
            max_tokens=max_tokens or None,
            model_kwargs=model_kwargs,
            model=model_name,
            base_url=openai_api_base,
            api_key=api_key,
            temperature=temperature if temperature is not None else 0.1,
            seed=seed,
        )
        if json_mode:
            if output_schema_dict:
                output = output.with_structured_output(schema=output_schema_dict, method="json_mode")  # type: ignore
            else:
                output = output.bind(response_format={"type": "json_object"})  # type: ignore

        return output  # type: ignore

    def _get_exception_message(self, e: Exception):
        """
        Get a message from an OpenAI exception.

        Args:
            exception (Exception): The exception to get the message from.

        Returns:
            str: The message from the exception.
        """

        try:
            from openai import BadRequestError
        except ImportError:
            return
        if isinstance(e, BadRequestError):
            message = e.body.get("message")  # type: ignore
            if message:
                return message
        return

json_mode.name: json_mode
json_mode.info: If True, it will output JSON regardless of passing a schema.

max_tokens.name: max_tokens
max_tokens.info: The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to 0 for unlimited tokens.

openai_api_base.name: openai_api_base
openai_api_base.info: The base URL of the OpenAI API. Defaults to https://api.openai.com/v1. You can change this to use other APIs like JinaChat, LocalAI and Prem.

output_schema.name: output_schema
output_schema.info: The schema for the Output of the model. You must pass the word JSON in the prompt. If left blank, JSON mode will be disabled.

seed.name: seed
seed.info: The seed controls the reproducibility of the job.

stream.name: stream
stream.info: Stream the response from the model. Streaming works only in Chat.

system_message.name: system_message
system_message.info: System message to pass to the model.
